alert.note: Alert for Flagler; Putnam; St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 4:13AM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Flagler, Putnam and St. Johns. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 411 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated waves of rain spreading across the advisory area. Minor flooding is likely in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Bunnell, Hastings, Andalusia, Saint Augustine Beach, Marineland, Crescent Beach, Butler Beach, Saint Augustine Shores, Saint Augustine South, Vilano Beach, Espanola, Dupont Center, Spuds, Elkton and Anastasia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
